name: Tax Loopholes
A Consistan Reina
description: So this is a deck I made after feeling that my biggest complain when playing my previous reina decks was: "If only I had x now". So the purpose of the deck is to consistently pull out your breaker sweep while keeping the Corp poor in the early game. I can't say it is perfect but I like how it has run so far and would like to here opinions on it.

name: Reinman
description: I've never played an Atman deck, and I wanted to give it a try. Rather than do the normal Shaper version, I thought I'd give an Anarch version a try, given that that's where most of the support comes from, and it's my preferred faction.

name: OverKATE3
Event of the century
description: Deck is dependant on getting Oracle May out as quick as possible. Then each turn just call Event and you will likely guess correct. If you trash a Breaker just use Test Run or Levy to get them back if you need to.

name: Ayano
GrapplingCHAOSv1.2
Kate Overmind 1.2
interface andy
Jinteki Shell Game (No ICE)
description:
This deck is about 60% serious. :)

The way this deck primarily scores--when you're not making way too many remotes for anybody's good--is to install Caprice in a server by herself ahead of time, then Install -> Advance -> Advance an agenda that can protect itself.

This deck won't win a tournament, but I can certify it's fun. As usual, suggestions welcome. Join the Remote Control Revolution!

name: Kate doubledecker v.9
description:
Doubles deck without the SFC. Similar breakers to prepaid chaos, uses femme as an inside job...kind of. Alpha and omega dictate which floor of ice femme lands on. Econ is surprisingly bursty, and might only suffer against replicating perfection due to the work compression, and CI because of their stupidly large hand size.

With some work this could be fairly good, I've won 3 games out of 5 with it, but I've had trouble adjusting to not having SMC in shaper. I'm not sure it will fare in other hands.

Scavenge moves femme around, keeps your test run breakers, lets you swap out alpha/omega for breakers in the heap for when you want to finalize your rig for the long haul.

Power Nap should be played any time past late early game, don't let the "gotta hold it" mindset take you :)

No HQ multi access makes me hate CI, and indexing isn't the greatest R&D, but with SOT and levy, you should be able to see it enough, and with these breakers repeat runs aren't too bad.

Maybe find a slot for deus X and SMC like the prepaid chaos build....

name: The Vampire Overmind v1.1
description:
Lately I've been trying to make Anarchs fast as Criminals and Shapers can be nowadays. Without decent draw (the upcoming Duggar's is a sad joke) and tutors (and Shapers will even get the Hardware tutor), it's pretty hard to engage the always improving defenses of the damn Corps.

Overmind + Wyldside can definitely increase your speed, actually allowing you to rush straight from the first turn.

You need a powerful economy for that as well, so there's plenty of events + Kati and Tri-maf. Vamp can take advantage of that, annoying the Corp and making her poor.

The only real issue comes from the long games, where multi access could definitely improve your chances to achieve victory, but Medium and or Nerve Agent would occupy MUs needed by Overmind, not to mention you'd need either multiple copies or a tutor (Djinn). Keyhole could be another solution, but it's even worse when it comes to MU and can't even be tutored.

name: Tennis Ace
description: This deck is playing a bit different than the FA Tennin deck. We still use ToL however we are running painful to steal agendas so we don't mind as much if they want to run on our remote and tax themselves finding out. Ideally save The Future Perfect for your matchpoint. Dump the Shi-Shocks into archives. Play some mind games with Mushin. t1 onto a Ronin or Junebug is a fun play.

name: Grappling gabe
description:
Gabe gets in, and gets in and early.

Grappling Hook and E3 allow for break any ice and work like an AI Faerie. E3 and Knight also have great synergy which is made even better with Gabe's "get in" mentality.

SOT, with Planned Assault allows for efficient use of our influence, and of course, abuse of Account Siphon.

name: Kitelle!
description:
The goal here is to ride the Torch Train.It's the most efficient breaker, that we're hoping to not pay for with Test Run and Scavenge.

Cards that mess with Ice are extra powerful for Kit, so the Datasucker + Parasite combo is in here. Kit's ability to place early pressure on the corp can be leveraged early, with a powerful long game via Toolbox Torch and Paintbrush.

name: Low running Connections
description:
Deck is designed to work on getting a DLR out and milling the corp. With a Joshua B, that's up to 4 cards a turn.

The real wish to do this came from wanting a deck that would "fuck the corp". With Xanadu Rook, Donut, and The source. Essentially putting up road blocks on all fronts. Due to influence concerns, that morphed into a connections deck that you see here.

I have thoughts on adding a couple blackmail enabling cards to this deck, Mostly the very reliable activist support + Raymond Flint. Though that starts to spread the deck thin, especially with no central multi access cards.

name: NBN FA
description: Score agendas, do it fast and often.

name: Weyland T&B
NBN FA 1.4
Silhouette v1.1
Big PsiCE with Pop-up Window
description: Make it very expensive to get into my advance-y remote, protect it with Caprice.

name: Test Anarch facile facile
description: Mazzo di test per anarch

The versatile deck!

Use what you have:

  • Got Biotics? GO Fast Advance!
  • Got big ice? GO Big Tower!
  • Got NAPD/Ash? GO Tax!

Use a variety of traps to keep the runner guessing!

The deck looks ridiculously inconsistent, but you can get lots of cash and lot of Ice variety to confuse the runner!

Also with all the install-able cards you will always take advantage of your ID!

Rez the Ice in the proper moment and dispatch great amounts of Brain Damage! (I've landed at least 1 BD in each game, that's a fact!).

Also I've managed to score Mandatory Upgrades more than ever before!

Don't forget to make your rival notice the size of the deck, that will throw him off his comfort zone, he won't know what to do!

And BTW, the agenda density is lower than in a 11 agenda 49 card deck! So keep them running R&D, let's see if they can find something! And if they do... PUNITIVE THEM!

name: Gabriel fixed ICE v 2.0
Good Guy Replication!
description:
So I decided to expand on the idea that my friend gave me about a not-gonna-kill-u Jinteki and this is what I came up with and I think I'm onto something, although it needs 1-2 polishing touches!

General Idea

  • Out-muscle the runner with money and expensive ICE
  • Play horizontal with MANY MANY "unprotected remotes"
  • Ruhr +Caprice combo

Agenda Spread

  • Just minimum size Agenda, you don't need any fancy stuff although Priority Req gives u free rezz on your expensive ICE and TFP has inherited protection from R*D and HQ sniping.
  • Philotic can kill them at 6 points if they don't know about it and leave a 0 advance card (which u will have plenty of)
  • If you have a choice between installing a Priority Req and TFP, go for Priority Req and keep TFP in hand.

Economy of this deck:

  • Private Contracts are replaced by Mental health Clinic, because unlike my Replicating Kills deck, we don't care about the runner having +1 hand size, because we won't kill him
  • Sundews as always awesome in RP
  • Diversified Portfolio! I knew that this card in the correct deck will be so strong! Now let's just have a look at HOW many remotes we will have down - 3x MHC , 3x Encrypt , 2x Tenma, 3x Sundew + 1 big remote + Random ice/uprgade just thrown there to exist ... 10-to-12 c for 1 Portfolio if everything is down? Pretty nice, right? ;) Of course it won't be down as much, but u can understand the potential of the card.

ICE

Barrier

  • Standard for me. Thought for a second abt WoT, because money shouldn't be a problem in this deck, but then decided to put on more Sentry instead of it

Code Gate(s)

  • Worth nothing that I don't run Shiro, which considering that the only thing that can hurt the runner from R*D is Shock! does not worth it.
  • The rest is pretty much my Standard Code Gate Jinteki spread, with having 1 more Inazuma, because we have spot for it.
  • Inazuma is simply amazing. Imagin Inazuma-ing them into a Rotto-turret or Grim for their Sentry breaker, GG ;D

Sentry

  • Just annoying, taxing and some harmful ICE. Rototurret and Grim for Program Trash and catching people off-guard. Shinobi kill some1 if u are swimming in money.

  • Susanoo! If u Susanoo them out of your Rurh Valley remote, it's just game :D Also Shocks in Archive! Be careful to not get Femm/Knight-ed! Having them to deal with that ICE+ the Ruhr with Caprice combo in the remote is just bonkers!

Note: Don't go too crazy on the bad pub, because it might remove the effect of them getting taxed on a central in the first click. But rezz when u can make an Impact (early game program trash, money drain or kill)

The Other cards:

  • Encryption Protocol - should be a gem in this deck. Not only it will give u money to DPF (Diversified Portfolio) but it will make them think A LOT about trashing your other naked asset/remotes or that unrezzed Ruhr Valley.
  • Tenma Line - is an interesting choise and I actually took 2 ICE from the 20 ICE count to lower it to 18 and get the 2 Tenma here. The idea is that once you install the agenda (might be 0 advance) in your remote, u can swap-around the ICE to make it the most taxing for the runner to get there and imagine if they don't get the bid on Caprice+ Ruhr after that lol. Also buffs DPF and won't see a trash if u have 1-2 Encryption Protocols out
  • Reclamation Order - there to pick up your used DPF, trashed Caprice/Ruhr/ Sundews and MHC whatever u need... but the general idea is to use it for DPF
  • Shocks! for some R*D protection and Susanoo combo

Some things to think about:

  • Depending on how helpful the Tenma are and how fast you are getting your agendas, it might worth it to have 2x Fast Track to draw in your Agendas when you have everything setup and ready to push your advantage for the win.
  • The exact count of Ruhr and Caprice might need testing, but for starters I've set 3 of each to have maximum chance to setup the remote
  • Throw in some Celebrity or Medical Fundraiser ( u don't really care about giving the runner 3c when you will out muscle him with so many remotes) in the place of Tenma/Shock/Caprice/Ruhr if the money feel low!

and nJoy the deck! I expect it to be quite crushing and I imagine somewhat similar playstyle to db0's untrashable decks!

Cheers, Dydra

name: New meta Noise
description: Started out as a Reina deck, and still should be - but times have changed and taxing 1 isn't as strong any more. So I've opted to tax their deck instead. the purpose of this deck is to continually drain the corp of its resources. Run often and keep them poor Don't bother clearing tags the corp will have to trash every resource you drop and at a loss to them *If your scared of being burned run some Plascretes I've been able to cautious or steal hard enough to stay out of blast range, but it just depends on what you think you'll be up against. Honestly closed accounts is scarier - just stay poor

name: Andi Link 2.0
description:
The basic idea is using andi's link Str to her advantage as she basically has no ability after the first turn (nothing new their). I am running the dagger because i found that the ninja was costing me too much money to get through poor sentry's and with the silencers i can make cheap runs through sentry's. The data dealer is in here as possible extra cash flow from a 1 pointer if needed and as an answer to shi.kyú. The Overmind i feel is better than a Crypiss most of the time. New Angeles is for tho's pesky Data Ravens and fall guy is their to keep them alive after a score. Helpful AI just their for a searchable +1 link and later when theirs a Dyson it can be used for the +2 Str. The E3's are in here for the Overmind, Grappling hook and HB ice if need be. Logo's gives me some more search which can be used for a fresh New angeles plus the extra hand size is nice. Mr Li allows me to wiz through my deck to find the things i need & The AR Lab lets me start all over again if needed.

Any pointers or comments welcome.

name: Is This Stupid Enough?
Power Of The Sun (Theory)
description:
The idea is to have a single server and reuse Adonis for cash till u have an agenda to score.

Another trick is using Oversight on big ICE one turn then returning them to hand for cash at start of your next turn. Also amazon lets you use a single ICE server with enigma or caduceus for free 3 Creds every turn for 1 click.

This is all just theory using whats currently out i look forward to seeing any new stuff that will complement this even more.

name: Midnight Psychic Sneak-Attack
description:
Overview

This deck is designed to, at your opponent’s first glance, look like a traditional Replicating Perfection deck. You start laying out Sundews and Pad Campaigns, and it looks like a very traditional RP vertical set-up. The ice is not too expensive, and will just go in front of HQ, R&D, and Archives to keep the runner taxed as they try to keep your remotes economy from getting too crazy. Heck, if they do not seem to be running your remotes, you can even start scoring unprotected agendas until they realize what you are doing.

But then you draw your Scorched Earth. Excellent. Eventually, they will get down to three or fewer cards in hand. Maybe they will hit Komainu or Tsurugi (or an Inazuma!) too close to the end of their turn. Maybe they will pull a Snare! from R&D. Maybe they will hit your Psychic Field you put in an unprotected remote (or they exposed it). Or maybe they just won't be thinking this deck is trying to kill them (this happens a lot) and just not draw up at the end of a turn. But whatever the reason, it will eventually happen. Then you drop the Cerebral Cast and they look at you funny. And they now get to choose: brain damage or tag. Either way, you win. If they take the tag, they die as you happily show them the Scorched Earth in your hand, the one they just moments ago foolishly assumed you were not packing. If they take the brain damage (this has never actually happened to me when I was playing someone who is playing this deck for the first time), then the chances of them getting down to three cards at the end of your turn increases, and when it happens, you pull this same move again.

Now, the deck is slightly more complicated than that, but that is generally how it works. Let’s look at a few aspects of the deck to better understand some of the finer points.

Agendas

All of the Agenda’s in the deck are selected to be able to be put in a remote one turn, looking like a Sundew or Pad Campaign or whatever else, and the next turn advanced and scored (or just scored out of hand in the case of Clone Retirement). If they do not appear to be running your Remote Servers, start playing Agendas in unprotected remote servers as described above. This gives you an advantage in points and forces the runner to speed up their game as they get worried, and it forces them to run more and set-up less, so they will have less creds and be less prepared.

Economy

Pad Campaign, Sundew, and Hedge Fund do a pretty good job of taking care of your economic needs, especially if you can get them out early game. And as discussed above, this helps keep your cover as a “peaceful” Jinteki deck (ha!).

Ice

The ice is designed to just protect your Central Servers a bit, but more to tax your opponent if they want to get to your remote servers. None of this Ice can just be encountered and allowed to fire off, without forcing some damage on the runner (which we don’t mind at all). The one exception to this is the single Himitsu-Bako. What is he doing there? Well, keep him in hand. He is your little secret. Later in the game when every credit matters, it is amazing how useful it is to lay him down in a new remote, put an agenda behind it, and let the runner realize too late that they need a barrier breaker out. It requires some timing, but it is amazing how well it works.

Cerebral and Scorch

As explained in the summary above, you use this to tag and bag. If needed, you should use Jackson to recover used Cerebral Casts, but this is actually rarely ever needed. It is also good to remember that Neural EMPs can be used to increase your kill range by one point. And also, in the unlikely event that they do decide to take the Brain Damage, DO NOT GIVE AWAY THAT YOU WERE HOPING THEY WOULD TAKE THE TAG! This requires some bluffing/acting. It is hard to keep cool, but if you can’t then this deck is probably not for you.

Neural EMP

A classic. And better when no one thinks it is in your deck. When someone hits the Psychic Field or a Komainu, you can effectively use these to finish them off before anything even gets going. In all of the competitive play I have done with this deck, no one is ever worried about a kill from RP (a.k.a. White Tree). Use this to your advantage.

Snare!

Snare is always good. But as Weyland players know all too well, the tag is just as dangerous as the damage. Once you start laying down remotes and they are not running them right away (usually waiting for you to Rez them first), then you start playing Agendas. Well, once they see this, they simply can’t keep allowing you to score Agendas. That is when you lay down the Snare!, and chances are, they will run it and take that tag. And with low cards, they may choose to draw cards rather than remover the tag. Or if they remove the tag but don’t draw back up to a full hand, it allows you to Cerebral and Scorch. It’s great!

False Leads

This is one of the few things that may tip off an opponent, but I think it is worth it. They may assume you have it in the deck to allow you to score an agenda, not for a kill. But if they take a tag from a Snare! (or give themselves a tag from an Account Syphon) or let their hand size drop to 1 or 0, use it and finish them off with the Scorch or Neural EMP. This is a powerful card in the right build, and this is that build. That one extra click they have to make before running remotes is PERFECT for this card.

Psychic Field

Well, there are a few reason for this seemingly out-of-place card. First, it can get your opponent down to 0 cards in hand, ripe for a Neural EMP. That is obvious. But also, Expose abilities are more and more common in runner decks, and this hits them right when they thought they were being careful, trigger off of an expose as well as an access. And it adds some variety and a bit of uncertainty in the runner’s mind. It might not be for everyone, but I have had great success with it in this deck.

name: Event Kate 1.1
description:
This is my take on an event driver Kate deck. The idea is that between all of the events/same old thing, SMC, and Clone Chip you can be very unpredictable and hopefully come up with solutions to get anywhere you need to be. Throw in indexing for a reliable method of attacking the centrals and you got this deck.

Also I know its strange that I don’t have test run or scavenging in the deck to “trick” out the feme (the one card that seems to end up installed in every game) but honestly when I need to install the feme I never seem to have trouble coming up with the creds.

Feed back welcome.

name: Toolbox Andi
description:
Mulligan aggressively Turn 1 play professional contacts / kati using a hostage Draw cards gain money and search for exactly what you need Build a rig and win the game

Planned assault tutors -Retrieval run: get some thing back if you lost it to power shutdown or archer -Account siphon: if you see an opening -Singularity: Against mushin no shin -Inside job: to get that 1 adgenda

Other searchables -Deus x: if your scared of kill-teki -The source: hurt fast advance -Data dealer: negative scoring agendas

S&W kills capris and Jackson Crash space protects against tag and bag

name: Ice Mill
description:
obviously this is pure speculation and theory, but oh my GOSH how exciting is the new Blue Sun ID? Get that ice out and rezzed with Oversight or BER, call it back next turn and reinstall it for cheap, rinse and repeat with Amazon Industrial / recurred OAI or BER.

literally no idea how this'll play, just building theory decks because i'm incorrigible B-)

name: Black Andy Geekway 2014
description: Idea is just to keep the corp poor early and continue to keep them poor late.

name: Notorious Stealth Blackmail Quest
description:
Special Order your central-only programs. Li and Logos help to get whatever else is needed (programs, connections and VoicePADs). Massive amounts of events, which help you keep hammering the hell out central servers.

Once the corp realizes a two-ice remote protects their agendas, give them bad pub via Frame Job then start the Blackmail runs. Quest Complete whatever you can't Blackmail.

Levy AR resets if key pieces of your rig get trashed. Mulligan it you have it in your opening hand.

name: Please Don't Whizz on the Bonzai Geekway 2014
description: An absolute ton of remotes. Put Caprice on one. Then add Ash. Then add Hokusai. Then watch them not want to waste time running and score as you please. Probably best opening hand is two Sundews and Encryption Protocol. This can be a really annoying deck to play against and eventually the opponent will make a mistake or you'll force them to do something they do not want to do.

name: Weyland tax (BP me more)
description: Card idea: Off the Grid - main deck engine, just only seeing this card makes your runner-opponent hate you. Caprice - early and mid game insurance of HQ safety. Another main card is Swarm, advance it to 8-9 counters. That means death to all rig sometimes. And after some scoring you have little points and a lot of BP, so we have Ireress just for it. Refinery often used as early game trap and tons of money for rezzing Swarm, Hadrian and Tollbooth. Shutdowns were included only for Corroder and overfulled Parasite meta everywhere. Ideal HQ sever is 2x Ireress, Swarm and Hadrian or Tollbooth. Rototurret is early facecheck punishment and also versus Kit. Any suggestions?

name: Mushin No Shin-anigans 2.0
description:
This is a Jinteki rush deck, which uses ambushes and Trick of Light to Fast Advance off of failed ambushes. The key card for setting up those ambushes and Trick of Light-batteries is Mushin no Shin.

Agendas

This is a standard Jinteki-Fast Advance assortment of agendas. All agendas are worth 2 points, so it always takes 3 agendas to win. 6 out of 9 agendas cost 3 or less (Braintrusts, 2nd and 3rd Medical Breakthroughs, and Philotic Entanglement). These can all be scored off of 1) a Mushin no Shin, 2) a Mushin'ed Plan B, or 3) a Trick of Light, making use of a failed ambush. Meanwhile, the 4-difficulty agendas are not meant for scoring, except in need. The NAPD contracts are taxing to steal, and the 1st Medical Breakthrough is useful regardless of whether it is scored or stolen.

Assets

There are five ambushes that are meant for Mushin no Shin. 3-advanced Junebugs are great for a flatline. A 3-advanced AggSecretary will curb-stomp a rig, and it is also useful at 1- or 2-advancements, if Mushin is not available. 3-advanced Plan Bs will score 6 out of 9 agendas. If the runner does not go for these traps, they become Trick of Light batteries. Meanwhile, Jackson Howard smooths out the flow of agendas. Shi.Kyu defends Archives, and potentially forces the runner to need 4 agendas to win.

Operations

Mushin no Shin and Trick of Light are the all-stars in this deck. The rest of the operations are a variety of economy cards. Green Level Clearance speeds up the deck while giving cash, and Hedge Fund is Hedge Fund. This deck does not need a ton of economy, since Mushin and Trick are cheap, and the ICE is pretty affordable. Also, Mushin no Shin is a sort of economy and a very effective one at that.

ICE

This is a rush deck, so the ICE layout includes lots of cheap End the Run (Himitsu-Bako, Quandary, Guard, Chimera). Guard is especially useful for single-handedly protecting a Mushin'ed agenda in an early-game rush. The rest of the ICE is more taxing and meant for protecting the centrals (Eli 1.0, Komainu, Tsurugi, Ichi 1.0, Grim). Inazuma is the one piece of positional ICE, but it is awesome in front of an Ichi 1.0, Komainu, or Tsurugi.

Other Notes

I had Hives in here, but they would crap out on me right when I need them the most, i.e. right when the runner was starting to really pound the centrals. I also tried out a GRNDL Refinery--it might be good, but I had to cut something in order to upgrade elsewhere. I'm not sure if Green Level Clearance is the ideal economy choice, but I think that it works better in this deck than Celebrity Gift did. Information is too precious. There are plenty of things that I wish that I could add--a second Shi.Kyu to ensure that the runner needs four agendas, another Aggressive Secretary, some sort of recursion (I briefly tried out a 1x Reclamation Order, but it was unlikely to show up when it was useful), or Fast Track for grabbing the third Medical Breakthrough.

name: Misdirection in Medtech
description:
It's simply just a 50-50 chance of getting an Agenda or a trap especially when one of them is installed via Mushin no Shin (a Junebug can mean instant kill). Just mislead the Runner in setting more remotes with equal advancement counters, more traps then only one 3-pointer agenda to camouflage. I never did a click-draw since this is 44-card deck, and it would heighten up the risk in getting agendas in R&D (via R&D interfaces, Medium, Keyhole) instead of remotes, even if it is toughened up with chunks of ICE. So if I didn't draw a fast econ in my mandatory draw and I got nothing to do, I'll just spend my turn gaining 3-creds.

HQ and Archive traps include Shock!, Snare!, and Shi.Kyu, while remote traps include Cerebral Overwriter, and Project Junebug; Susanoo-no-Mikoto and Inazuma are a very good duo since it can also tax aside from flushing Runners to archives that's of course full of Shocks and Shi.Kyus; Shiro is also a good top deck filterer, and a bit of taxing; Komainu, Tsurugi, and Wall of Thorns are a bit expensive (that is why I put Priority Requisition), but also efficient in buying time to set up (since they tax-up the Runners), and also can be aggressive in net damage; Celebrity Gift, Medical Research Fundraiser, and Hedge Fund for fast econs.

Any thoughts? Thanks for reading!
